subject: Law
title: The Eighth Amendment: Cruel and Unusual
description: One-minute skill: The Eighth Amendment: Cruel and Unusual.

hook.text: A man was sentenced to life in prison for stealing $150 worth of videotapes. Was that cruel and unusual?

buildup.text: The Eighth Amendment bans excessive bail, excessive fines, and cruel and unusual punishment.

discovery.text: Courts use a 'proportionality' test: does the punishment fit the crime?

twist.text: What's 'cruel and unusual' evolves. Practices once acceptedâ€”like public floggingâ€”are now clearly banned.

climax.text: The Supreme Court has banned execution of juveniles and the intellectually disabled under this amendment.

punchline.text: Punishment must fit the crime. Society decides what 'fit' means.

quiz.question: What test do courts apply under the Eighth Amendment?
